intro: Eschscholzia robusta, commonly known as the robust poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking red or orange petals and a distinctive, hairy stem. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. Eschscholzia robusta is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppy species.
